comment.author: 8793648@N06
comment._content: Annoying photo; no one close enough to date the dresses, no vehicles in sight; but I'm sending the link to the local studies librarian at Pencrith to see if she can date it by the buildings.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
Yes I know - I was initially thinking of it for a "Can you date?" on the Archives Outside blog but thought it might be too frustrating!
-AG

comment.author: 73199923@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] Do you know if it is part of a collection like that of Sam Hood ?

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: I believe that there is a photograph from the Sam Hood collection at the State Library of New South Wales dated 1940 which shows a view of part of the far river bank above. The 1940 trees are somewhat more immature than the trees shown here. If indeed the 1940 Hood photo does show part of the same location, then it suggests a date for this photograph perhaps 10 years later although a botanist/horticulturalist/arboralist may give a better idea of the years versus tree growth equation. See the 1940 Sam Hood photo here: acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=130118#

comment.author: 63385174@N06
comment._content: Its a four's race, possibly the 1st Fours as an eight boat is headed down to the start in the background. The race is over and the winners are still rowing!!! They have a dark line down the back of their singlets so it is probably Newington College.
